Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies are looking to stop a four-game road losing streak when they face the Washington Nationals.The Phillies have a 94-67 overall record and a 40-40 record on the road.The Nationals have a 71-90 overall record and a 38-42 home record.The teams are playing for the 13th time this season, with the Phillies leading the series 8-4.Luis Garcia leads the Nationals with 17 home runs and a.438 slugging percentage.Bryce Harper has 42 doubles and 30 home runs for the Phillies.The game is scheduled for Sunday, September 29, at 3:05 p.m. EDT.Aaron Nola is expected to pitch for the Phillies, while Jake Irvin will take the mound for the Nationals.The Phillies have a 40-40 road record with a.325 on-base percentage, the fifth-best in MLB.The Nationals have the ninth-ranked team batting average in the NL at.243.Both teams have similar recent performances, with the Nationals slightly better in batting average and ERA.Several players from both teams are on the injured list, impacting their lineups.
